comments.content: This issue happens because React re-renders components when state changes. You can optimize it by using React.memo.
I had the same problem! Try using the useEffect hook to avoid unnecessary state updates.
To optimize SQL queries, make sure you have proper indexing and try to limit the number of joins.
CORS errors are usually fixed by enabling CORS in the server-side API or using a proxy.
WebSockets in Node.js can be handled using the 'ws' library for real-time communication.
